title: Bayer Strives to End Lawsuits Over Roundup-While Still Selling It
summary: German pharmaceutical giant faces unusual legal predicament, experts say. Bayer AG faces an extraordinary challenge as it tries to settle tens of thousands of claims that its Roundup weedkiller causes cancer: The product remains on the shelves, making it almost impossible to put the litigation to rest forever.

summary: Democrats step up calls for investigations, saying president's public comments tainted sentencing process. title: Prosecutors in Stone Case Are Justice Department Veterans
summary: The four lawyers who withdrew from the case have mostly worked in nonpolitical positions inside and outside the department. title: Software Engineers' Pay Is Rising Faster Outside Silicon Valley
summary: Average salaries grew 13% in London and 7% in Toronto and New York, outpacing 6% increase for San Francisco Bay Area. summary: New York governor intends to tell President Trump that ban is 'pure politics'. New York Gov. summary: In January, crude prices plunged 20% over 19 days as the coronavirus outbreak fueled fears of a global slowdown. A scramble by Wall Street to reduce exposure to falling oil prices may have hastened crude's recent descent.

title: New York Senate Proposes Change to Bail Law, Angering Assembly Democrats
summary: Senate leaders propose to give judges discretion over detaining people before trial after warnings from police officials, prosecutors. ALBANY, N.Y.-The debate over New York's new bail law morphed into a clash between Democrats in the state Assembly and Senate Wednesday after Senate leaders proposed major changes that would give judges additional discretion to order people detained before their trial.

title: Surge in Euro Borrowing Could Store Up Trouble for Later
summary: Speculative carry trades and other forms of borrowing by foreigners is keeping the euro lower than it would be otherwise. The euro is cheaper than many think it ought to be. One explanation: A surge in euro-based borrowing abroad is weighing the currency down. This could make the euro prone to wild swings in the future.

title: Democratic Candidates Set for Long Haul Following New Hampshire
summary: Candidates are shifting focus to later primaries as they prepare to crisscross the country through Super Tuesday. The top Democratic presidential candidates began shifting focus to later primaries and prepared for a drawn-out delegate fight after the outcome in New Hampshire ensured the race to challenge President Trump in November will remain heated.

title: OPEC Sees Coronavirus Weighing Heavily on Oil Demand
summary: China imports more oil than any other country, but virus outbreak is slowing demand. LONDON-The impact of the coronavirus will depress global oil demand growth this year, OPEC said Wednesday, as China, the world's largest importer of oil, confronts the fast-spreading pathogen.

title: CVS Swings to Profit, Forecasts 2020 Results in Line With Estimates
summary: Capping first year of integrating Aetna operations, the pharmacy operator tops earnings expectations. CVS Health Corp. turned a profit that beat Wall Street expectations and projected results for 2020 that matched estimates, as it capped its first year of integrating health insurer Aetna Inc.'s operations.

title: Improving Health Care for Older Americans
summary: Catching the dementia, the lack of support system, the physical deterioration early, creating a workable plan to help the situation and following up to ensure implementation occurs-this is the heartbeat of a medical social worker. Use us!. I heartily agree with Elizabeth Goldberg on "How To Improve Health Outcomes for Older Americans" (op-ed, Feb. 10). Almost all of the suggested ways to address the eldercare crisis, and the recommended steps toward a solution, involve domains that are covered by medical and geriatric social workers. We are uniquely trained to pick up on the clues of an elder in crisis, to understand the complex circumstances and issues involved and, with our knowledge of community resources, to intervene in a way that supports the senior's dignity as well as their safety. Too often hospitals insist that already overworked nurses can make discharge plans, or doctors without the opportunity to see the whole picture can write prescriptions as grandma is wheeled out the door.

title: Give Marijuana Tax Revenues to the Harmed
summary: We have a moral imperative to try to right the wrongs of the war on drugs. We should start by investing in the very communities it harmed.. Using cannabis tax revenues to plug local budget holes has been an effective talking point in advancing marijuana-legalization proposals across the country ("Cities Look to Marijuana Taxes for Help," U.S. News, Feb. 5). However, it is vital that lawmakers also use these cannabis tax revenues to fund programs that serve the individuals whose lives and communities have been destroyed by the misguided, racially biased policies of America's war on drugs. Decriminalization and expungement bills don't go far enough.

title: Chicago's Bonds Aren't Akin to Puerto Rico's
summary: Chicago has been clear that the proceeds will repay higher-cost debt. That's not a con but the equivalent of refinancing a mortgage to help pay for a child's education.. Regarding your editorial "Chicago's Puerto Rican Bonds" (Feb. 1): Labeling Chicago's new issuance of sales-tax-backed bonds a "shell scheme" is a poor analogy. Chicago has been clear that the proceeds will repay higher-cost debt. That's not a con but the equivalent of refinancing a mortgage to help pay for a child's education. Rather than "diluting" other creditors, the city's move helps it achieve its goals. In positing that investors are so starved for yield that Chicago was able to essentially dupe them, the editorial overlooks key realities.

title: Fannie and Freddie Remain a Risk to Federal Taxpayers
summary: We might repeat the financial market crash of 2008, but Wall Street will be able to shift the ultimate credit risk to the taxpayer.. Chuck Mansfield writes: "Fannie and Freddie had overextended themselves and were facing dire financial consequences" ("Legislators and Regulators Failed in 2007," Letters, Feb. 6). Fannie and Freddie did finally fail, which led to the biggest financial crash since the Great Depression. Congress created a new independent federal housing agency to supervise them. Unfortunately, with Wall Street's encouragement in September 2019, President Trump proposed "returning" Fannie and Freddie to the private market with a government "guarantee" (The old Fannie and Freddie had just an implicit federal backstop.) So we might repeat the financial market crash of 2008, but Wall Street will be able to shift the ultimate credit risk to the taxpayer.

title: Pope Rebuffs Call for Married Priests in the Amazon

Rather, these over-50 actors were among the celebrities who wore tinted eyeglasses throughout this winter's Hollywood awards-season. Mr. Keitel and Mr. John both sported tinted lenses at January's Golden Globes ceremony as well as at last Sunday's Oscars (sepia for the actor, scarlet and lavender for the Rocketman). summary: Resume Subscription. China has a bad reputation when it comes to the environment, but things are starting to change. That is great news for the planet. It is bad news, though, for suppliers of plastics and other goods that end up as waste in its landfills or haze in its skies.

title: Bloomberg to Open New Hampshire Office-After Primary
summary: Former New York mayor says he will keep the office open through November, regardless of whether he is on the ballot. CONCORD, N.H.-As Democratic presidential campaigns shut down their operations in the Granite State, former New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg is opening a new office here and hiring nearly a dozen staffers as part of his general election efforts against President Trump.

title: U.S. and Taliban Move Toward Deal to End War
summary: A reduction in violence in Afghanistan would be the first step, but progress remains fragile. WASHINGTON-The U.S. and Taliban are expected to announce a reduction in violence in Afghanistan as early as Wednesday, which could lead to the signing of a deal to withdraw all U.S. troops, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Top Takeaways From New Hampshire's Democratic Primary
summary: Sanders and Buttigieg are in tight race for lead; Klobuchar surges as Warren, Biden falter. NASHUA, N.H.-New Hampshire voters lifted Bernie Sanders to a narrow victory on Tuesday, cementing the Vermont senator's status as a leading contender for the Democratic presidential nomination.

title: The Secret to This Coconut Shrimp's Crunch
summary: Succulent shrimp and green beans simmered in coconut milk get a delightful pop of texture from a coarse grind of toasted yellow split peas and spices. OFTEN IT BEGINS with an ingredient. In this case, Cheetie Kumar was browsing her local market in Raleigh, N.C., when she spotted some beautiful shrimp. From there she free-associated: "Who hasn't had shrimp and green beans at a Chinese restaurant?" Eventually she hit upon this sumptuous sauté of shrimp and green beans simmered in coconut milk, her final Slow Food Fast recipe.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Essential Tried to Upend Smartphones. Now It Is Shutting Down.
summary: Andy Rubin, who had also co-founded Google's Android business, sought to take on industry giants Samsung and Apple. Essential Products Inc., the smartphone company from the father of Google's Android mobile software, is shutting down after less than five years in business and raising $330 million in funding.

title: The Sanders Plurality
summary: The socialist wins in a splintered New Hampshire field as his voters stay loyal.. The good news for democracy Tuesday was that in New Hampshire they know how to count votes. That's especially good news for Bernie Sanders, who was denied his election night TV time in Iowa last week but not this time as he narrowly won the Granite State. Whether that's good news for the Democratic Party is another story.

title: América Móvil Profit Jumps in Fourth Quarter
summary: Latin America's biggest wireless operator by subscribers made a profit of $1.14 billion. MEXICO CITY-Net profit at Mexican telecommunications company América Móvil SAB rose 63% in the fourth quarter from a year earlier, despite a lag on revenue growth from a stronger Mexican peso.

title: Michael Bennet Drops Out of Democratic Presidential Race
summary: Colorado senator ran as a centrist and criticized views of some of his more liberal rivals. Colorado Sen. Michael Bennet, a Democrat who ran for president as a centrist and criticized the policies of some of his more liberal rivals, dropped out of the race after failing to gain enough traction.

title: Actor Jussie Smollett Indicted on Charges of Faking Hate Crime
summary: New charges come nearly a year after similar ones were dismissed. CHICAGO-A grand jury on Tuesday indicted actor Jussie Smollett on six counts of disorderly conduct for falsely reporting a hate crime, nearly a year after similar charges were dismissed.

title: Canadian National Railway Threatens to Shut Down Corridors Blocked by Protests
summary: Demonstrators say they are backing indigenous groups opposed to construction of pipeline in British Columbia. OTTAWA- Canadian National Railway Co. said it would shut down large parts of its network unless anti-pipeline protesters thwarting rail traffic along two key corridors were removed.

title: CoStar to Buy Apartment Search Firm RentPath for $588 Million
summary: RentPath says it will seek chapter 11 bankruptcy protection. CoStar Group Inc. has agreed to buy RentPath Inc. for $588 million, as the real-estate data giant pushes deeper into the fast-growing business of helping renters find apartments online.

title: Lyft's Net Loss Widens as It Focuses on Profitable Growth
summary: Ride-hailing company reports 22.9 million active users at end of 2019. SAN FRANCISCO- Lyft Inc. said it is still on track to reach a measure of profitability by the end of next year, even as it posted a wider fourth-quarter net loss compared with the year-earlier period.

title: O'Brien Says Vindman Removal Wasn't Retaliation
summary: National security adviser Robert O'Brien said he wasn't instructed by President Trump to remove Army Lt. Col. Alexander Vindman and his brother. WASHINGTON-National security adviser Robert O'Brien said it was his decision to remove Army Lt. Col. Alexander Vindman from the National Security Council and rejected critics' charge that the move marked retaliation for his testimony during the House impeachment investigation.

title: Prosecutors Quit Stone Case After DOJ Seeks Less Prison Time
summary: Moves come after Trump criticized the initial sentence recommendation; Democrats see improper influence by president. WASHINGTON-Four federal prosecutors withdrew from the case against Roger Stone on Tuesday, with one resigning as an assistant U.S. attorney, as the Justice Department reversed itself and recommended less prison time for President Trump's longtime confidant.

title: Alan Dershowitz Accuses David Boies of Extortion in Defamation Suit
summary: The two American legal titans have escalated their battle as they tangle in the aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and suicide. The feud between two of America's best-known attorneys has escalated, with Alan Dershowitz filing a defamation suit against David Boies.

title: Sudan Agrees in Principle to Extradite Ex-Leader Bashir for Prosecution
summary: Surprise move that could see the former strongman face trial over genocide and war crime charges. Sudan's transitional government has agreed in principle to extradite former leader Omar al-Bashir to the International Criminal Court, a surprise move that could see him face trial over genocide and war crime charges.

title: FAA Says It Failed to Properly Oversee Safety at Southwest Airlines
summary: Agency acknowledges regulatory lapses stretching back years and pledges to put new controls in place. Federal aviation regulators acknowledged multiple failures overseeing safety at Southwest Airlines Co. and agreed to implement nearly a dozen recommendations spelled out in a report by the Department of Transportation's inspector general.

title: Puerto Rico Bank to Pay $1 Million to Resolve Investigation Related to PdVSA Transactions
summary: As part of the resolution, the U.S. Justice Department agreed to return $53 million in seized funds to the bank and end its investigation. Bank of San Juan Internacional Inc. agreed to pay $1 million to resolve a federal investigation into alleged money laundering, the U.S. Department of Justice said.

title: Opposition Leader Juan Guaidó Returns to Venezuela
summary: Mr. Guaidó is swarmed by opposition lawmakers and supporters of his rival as he returns from U.S., Europe trip. Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaidó returned to Caracas Tuesday after he slipped out of the country last month in defiance of a travel ban for a high-profile trip to meet with President Trump at the White House and world leaders gathered at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

title: Michael Bloomberg's 'Racism'
summary: Everyone's piling on unfairly, including President Trump.. President Trump has felt the sting of glib and unfair accusations of racism. So it's a pity he would level one of his own against fellow New Yorker and potential presidential rival Michael Bloomberg. In a now-deleted tweet, the President wrote "WOW, BLOOMBERG IS A TOTAL RACIST!"

title: Liberal Faculty Endorse Testing
summary: A California task force shows that banning tests helps the privileged.. Breaks from progressive orthodoxy on campus are rare these days, so they're worth supporting when they happen. In the latest miracle, a task force of the faculty senate at the University of California, of all places, is resisting the movement to ban test scores in admissions.

title: The Promise of the Trump Peace Plan
summary: It would bypass corrupt and dictatorial Palestinian leaders who have stalled the process since 1993.. To complete his "deal of the century," President Trump forces Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to shake hands with . . . nobody. "For years we tried making peace with the Palestinians," Mr. Netanyahu marvels, "but only you thought of this genius move: making peace without Palestinians."

title: Coronavirus Needs a Free Press
summary: The U.S. stands a better chance than Wuhan because the public is informed.. China has declared a people's war on the Wuhan virus. President Xi Jinping's leadership is being tested, but so is the argument that a regime that at first underreacted now is overreacting. A young doctor who died after being interrogated for sounding the alarm about the virus has become a rallying symbol for reformers.

title: Democrats, Don't Hit the Panic Button
summary: Candidates rarely look impressive-or the party united-at this stage.. Rarely has a political party gone from confidence to gloom as quickly as Democrats did last week. In rapid-fire blows, impeachment foundered in the Senate, President Trump delivered a politically effective State of the Union address, and the Iowa caucuses imploded in a flurry of intraparty recriminations.
